page.title: 18COMMUNITY RELATIONS.
page.content: Large numbers of immigrants started to arrive in Bolton in the 1950's. They chose Bolton because there were jobs for them in the cotton mills. Of the 260,000 people who live in Bolton,about 20,000 belong to ethnic minority groups. The largest group, about 15,000,have come from the Gujarat State in India.In addition there are quite large groups of West Indians,2000+,and Pakistanis 2000. There are also much smaller groups of Iranians,Bangladeshis,Chinese,Irish and Polish.Bolton has appointed a team of six community relations officers to help the minority groups with their problems.The main problems are with language,housing and jobs.They arrange language classes in homes and schools to give the Asian ladies a chance to learn English.They are available to help in legal matters when requested.
